Honorific decree for Mardonios, a Persian landowner
Granted citizenship, and probably privileges associated with his position as a Persian landowner incorporated into the Apollonian civic body.

Honorific decree of the Neoteichetai and Kiddiokomitai for Banabelos and Lachares
Banabelos and Lachares were oikonomos and eklogistes under Achaios.
Honorific decree of the Neoteichetai and Kiddiokomitai for Banabelos and Lachares
Banabelos and Lachares paid the ransom for prisoners of the Galatian war by interceding with Achaios.

Honorific decree of the Neoteichetai and Kiddiokomitai for Banabelos and Lachares
A bull to be sacrificed to Achaios, and two rams and three sheep for Banabelos and Lachares, each year.

Honorific statue-base for the financial officer Menodoros set up by the policemen of the Eriza region
Menodoros' honours were possibly for resolving some a financial matter involving the people of Eriza, as he was official in charge of revenues.

Kephisodoros held the gymnasiarchy, perhaps at his own cost.
He was honoured by the neoi in an unspecified way.
Kephisodoros dedicated cult-statues of the Attalid kings.
Eumenes II had granted 3,000 drachmas to the city.
Kephisodoros gave an unknown amount of drachmas towards funding for Hermaia and Herakleia festivals, likely also covering expenditure for contests.
Kephisodoros gave an unknown amount of drachmas towards funding for Hermaia and Herakleia festivals, likely also covering expenditure for contests.
City had provided grain to the king's soldiers during a recent war.

Letter of Antiochos III to Zeuxis on the appointment of Nikanor as high-priest
The text is otherwise identical to that known from Pamuku in Mysia, SEG 37.1010.
Letters of Eumenes II to the priest Attis

Eumenes instructs Attis to send him the dedications, presumably meaning temple revenues.

Letter of Eumenes II to Toriaion
Letter of Eumenes II to Toriaion
Eumenes sends capable men to the community to set up its council, civic offices, and civic tribes, as well as a gymnasium.
Letter of Eumenes II to Toriaion
Toriaians resolve on building a gymnasium and supplying it with oil.
Letter of Eumenes II to Toriaion
Eumenes grants the city the income from the agoranomia for the purchaase of oil for the gymnasium.
Letter of Eumenes II to Toriaion
Regulation on the sources of income that will supply the gymnasium in the future, with reference to the dekate.
